title: CN Level 10 — Secure Web App Networking
concept: Scenario-based design questions for a secure web application deployment.

challenges.title: Q1: Secure Deployment Architecture
challenges.description: Design a high-level network architecture for hosting a secure web application. Include components like load balancer, web servers, database, and indicate which parts are exposed to the Internet and which are in a private network.
challenges.outputDescription: Diagram-style text description of public vs private segments (checked manually).
examples: Think of: Internet → load balancer in public subnet → app servers in private subnet → DB in deeper private subnet.
challenges.starterCode: // Describe the components, their placement (public/private), and basic data flow.

challenges.title: Q2: HTTPS & Firewall Rules
challenges.description: Explain how HTTPS and firewall rules help secure the web application in the above architecture. Mention what traffic is allowed from the Internet and what is restricted between subnets.
challenges.outputDescription: Explanation of TLS for encryption and firewall rules for access control (checked manually).
examples: Example: Allow HTTPS (443) from Internet to load balancer only, allow app servers to talk to DB on specific port.
challenges.starterCode: // Describe how HTTPS protects data in transit and how firewall rules restrict access.
